    • Method Detail

      • getDistanceAxis

        public static double getDistanceAxis(java.lang.Float jointPosA,
                                     java.lang.Float jointPosB)
        Gets the distance between two joint positions on a single axis. This is reused for the x-, y- and z-axis'.
        Parameters:
        jointPosA - The first joint's position on whatever axis we're dealing with.
        jointPosB - The second joint's position on whatever axis we're dealing with.
        Returns:
        The distance between the two joint positions. Note that this value will never be negative as it is a magnitude!

      • getDistance

        public static double getDistance(com.primesense.nite.Point3D<java.lang.Float> jointA,
                                 com.primesense.nite.Point3D<java.lang.Float> jointB)
        This gets the distance between two joint positions over 3 axis'. Note: This uses the distance formula. Point3D is a OpenNI data type -- refer to the documentation directory within this project -- with Point3D(Float x, Float y, Float z) being the constructor.
        Parameters:
        jointA - This is the first joint's position.
        jointB - This is the second joint's position.
        Returns:
        The distance between the two joints. Note that this value will never be negative as it is a magnitude!

      • getDistance

        public static double getDistance(double[] point,
                                 com.primesense.nite.Point3D<java.lang.Float> joint)
        This gets the distance between a point and some joint. Note: This uses the distance formula. Point3D is a OpenNI data type -- refer to the documentation directory within this project -- with Point3D(Float x, Float y, Float z) being the constructor.
        Parameters:
        point - This is an array of double values that represents a point's position in 3D space. So there must be 3 values in the array AND they should follow the x, y, z ordering. Important Note: It is assumed that this argument ALWAYS has 3 items within it. This function is called very often and it should already be ensured that the given point is valid.
        joint - This is the joint's position.
        Returns:
        The distance between the point and joint. Note that this value will never be negative as it is a magnitude!

      • getAngle

        public static double getAngle(com.primesense.nite.Point3D<java.lang.Float> jointA,
                              com.primesense.nite.Point3D<java.lang.Float> vertex,
                              com.primesense.nite.Point3D<java.lang.Float> jointB)
        Get the angle at a vertex given three joints. Note: This uses the law of cosines to determine the angle.
        Parameters:
        jointA - End1 of the angle.
        vertex - The vertex of the angle.
        jointB - End2 of the angle.
        Returns:
        A double of the angle between these three joints, in degrees.
